**Lab 7**

Exercise 1

Write a Java program to create a folder called &quot;files&quot; and write the following data to a text file. Use a comma as the delimiter.

The Great Wall,Thriller,2017,3,2

John Wick Chapter 2,Action,2017,5,0

Logan,Action, 2017,0,5

Loving,Drama,2017,4,1

You will use this file later on in the following exercise.

Exercise 2

The goal of this exercise is to implement a simple stock control system for a new DVD rental store.

DVD Class

- .Has 7 member variables
  - .title &amp; category (both String)
  - .year, quantity in stock, quantity checked out, rating total, rating count

There are 5 copies of each DVD in the store (use a constant)

Write a constructor that initialises 5 of the members using a parameter list

The rating total &amp; rating count should be set to 0.



Write suitable getter methods.

Write a rateDVD method which takes the rating (double) as a parameter

- .The rating has to be between 1 and 5. If not, display an error
- .If the rating is valid then you need to add it to the rating sum and increment the count

Write a method getAverageRating() which calculates and returns the average rating (double) for a DVD

- .Use the rating sum and the count for this calculation.

Write a method checkOut() which updates the quantity in stock and the quantity checked out.

Write a returnDVD method which returns a Boolean value.

- .In this method you need to make sure that when a DVD is returned the quantity in stock and the number of DVDs checked out cannot exceed the max.
- .If it does exceed the max then display a message &quot;DVD does not belong to this store&quot; and return false.

Write a toString method which formats the data as shown in the sample output on page 3



DVDCollection Class

- .Has one member variable
  - .A collection of DVDs (arraylist)



Write an addDVD() method which takes 5 parameters. Create a DVD object and add it to the collection

Write a checkOutDVD() method which takes one parameter representing the number of the DVD.

- .This method is called in the test class where the user enters a number for the DVD instead of having to type in the name of the DVD
- .Use this number value (subtract 1) to retrieve the DVD from the collection
- .If the DVD is in stock then call the checkout method in the DVD class
- .If the DVD is not in stock then you should throw an OutOfStockException. You need to create this exception. Handle the exception inside this method also



Write a returnDVD() method which takes one parameter representing the number of the DVD and returns a Boolean value.

- .Use this number value to retrieve the DVD from the collection
- .Call the returnDVD method in the DVD class and use the value returned from the method in the DVD class to set the Boolean variable in this class



Write a rateDVD() method which takes two parameters representing the number of the DVD and the rating(double)

- .Use the number value to retrieve the DVD from the collection
- .Call the rateDVD() method in the DVD class



Write a mostPopular() method which searches the collection and returns a DVD object with the highest average rating.



Write a displayDVDList() method which displays the following DVD information formatted as shown:

DVDs

DVD Number: 1 Title: The Great Wall               Number Available: 3

DVD Number: 2 Title: John Wick Chapter 2          Number Available: 5

DVD Number: 3 Title: Logan                                Number Available: 0

DVD Number: 4 Title: Loving                               Number Available: 4









Write a method called writeToFile() which write the following data to a new file formatted

as shown. Here you should call the toString method you wrote in the DVD class:



 ![](data:image/*;base64,)

Test Class

Write code in the main method to do the following:

Create a DVDCollection object

Open the file from exercise 1 and read in the data from this file

Use this data to create DVD objects and add them to the arraylist in the DVDCollection class

Write code to display the following menu to the user:

Please press 1 to rent a DVD

Please press 2 if you want to return a DVD

Please press 3 to save details to file

Press 4 to quit

Write code for each of the menu options. Here is sample output for options 1, 2 and 3

Option 1

Please press 1 to rent a dvd

Please press 2 if you want to return a dvd

Please press 3 to save details to file

Press 4 to quit

1

DVDs

DVD Number: 1 Title: The Great Wall               Number Available: 3

DVD Number: 2 Title: John Wick Chapter 2          Number Available: 5

DVD Number: 3 Title: Logan                                Number Available: 0

DVD Number: 4 Title: Loving                               Number Available: 4

Enter the number of the DVD you wish to rent?

1

DVDs

DVD Number: 1 Title: The Great Wall               Number Available: 2

DVD Number: 2 Title: John Wick Chapter 2          Number Available: 5

DVD Number: 3 Title: Logan                                Number Available: 0

DVD Number: 4 Title: Loving                               Number Available: 4

Please press 1 to rent a dvd

Please press 2 if you want to return a dvd

Please press 3 to save details to file

Press 4 to quit

When the user enters option 1, they are shown the list of DVDs and are then asked which DVD they wish to rent. In this example, the user entered 1 for the first DVD. When the user pressed the enter key the list of DVDs is displayed again showing reduced availability for the first DVD. The menu is also displayed again.

Option 2

Please press 1 to rent a DVD

Please press 2 if you want to return a DVD

Please press 3 to save details to file

Press 4 to quit

2

DVDs

DVD Number: 1 Title: The Great Wall               Number Available: 2

DVD Number: 2 Title: John Wick Chapter 2          Number Available: 5

DVD Number: 3 Title: Logan                                Number Available: 1

DVD Number: 4 Title: Loving                               Number Available: 4

Enter the number of DVD you wish to return?

2

DVD does not belong to this store

Please press 1 to rent a DVD

Please press 2 if you want to return a DVD

Please press 3 to save details to file

Press 4 to quit

When the user enters option 2 to return a DVD, they are then asked which DVD they wish to return. In this case the user entered the 2

# nd
 DVD but there are already 5 of these DVDs in stock. An error message is display informing the user that the DVD does not belong to this store.

A valid return is shown below. Here the user is asked to rate the DVD.
